title: A fight breaks out on set of Home and Away
text:
It's Channel Seven's long-running family drama.

And it looks like Home and Away is about to turn up the heat and welcome several new actors from the land of the long white cloud onto the show in 2020.

On Monday, several long-standing cast members - including Shane Withington, Georgie Parker and Lukas Radovich - found themselves caught up in a brutal fight scene that could very well introduce the new motley crew.

Are they the new River Boys? A fight broke out on the set of Channel Seven's Home and Away... as several new cast members from New Zealand arrived in Summer Bay. Pictured Rob Kipa Williams (far left)

Let's go! The scene kicked off with new cast member Rob (left) sizing up fellow newcomer Ethan Browne (right) in Sydney's Palm Beach

The scene kicked off with new cast member Rob Kipa Williams sizing up fellow newcomer Ethan Browne in Sydney's Palm Beach.

Rob - who starred on Channel Seven's 800 Words - is about to show his Kiwi brother what he's made of. Well, that looks to be the story line.

At one point while filming the intense scene, Rob is seen throwing a punch.



Having a swinging good time: In the blink of an eye, Rob takes a shot at Ethan

Smack! Bam! Pow! Rob connects by the looks of it, as Lukas Radovich, Georgie Parker and Shane Withington (back left to right) gather around for a gander

Run while you can mate! In reality, Ethan is actually an accomplished martial artist, who has a black belt in Taekwondo and likes to practice kung fu and weight lifting in his spare time

In reality, Ethan is actually an accomplished martial artist, who has a black belt in Taekwondo and likes to practice kung fu and weight lifting in his spare time.

Seconds into the melee, newcomer Bree Peters swoops in to break up the fight, as horrified Summer Bay locals watch on in disgust.

Then, in the blink of an eye, the action is over, the dust settles and everything goes back to normal.

Break it up! Seconds into the melee, newcomer Bree Peters (centre) swooped in to break up the fight, as horrified Summer Bay locals watched on in disgust

If looks could kill: Then, in the blink of an eye, the action was over, the dust settled and everything went back to normal

It's over! Ethan (right) is seen walking off into the distance with fellow newcomer Kawakawa Fox-Reo (left)

Having fun between takes: Newcomers Rob Kipa Williams (left), Kawakawa Fox-Reo (middle) Ethan Browne (right) in Sydney's Palm Beach

Ethan is seen walking off into the distance with barely a scratch on him.

He's joined by newcomer Kawakawa Fox-Reo, who also hails from New Zealand.

Expect the rough and tumble newcomers to arrive in Summer Bay in 2020.
description: It's Channel Seven's long-running family drama.
authors: Shannon Shipley For Daily Mail Australia
